intro: Ochlandra travancorica var. hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy ochlandra, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels. The species is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its attractive foliage and floral display.
